website_summaries.verdict: For far less investment than other comparable dual mount monitor stands, this fully articulated model allows users to create an ergonomic-friendly and comfortable work space.
pros: Screens rotate 360 degrees to allow the reading of longer documents
Monitor cables can be attached using included hardware to keep tangles at a minimum
Either clamp onto desk, or attach through desk hole
Instructions are easy to follow, and installation takes around 30 minutes
cons: Doesn't free up as much desk space as models with swinging arms
Some users report that heavier monitors tend to droop

website_summaries.verdict: A dedicated solution for a true dual monitor setup. Retains full functionality and articulation due to the smart support arm design and construction.
pros: Ability to move each monitor independently allows for a variety of positions and setups above the desk
cons: The support fastener can leave marks on certain types of desk surfaces when too much pressure is applied

customer_reviews.title: Version 2 Sucks.
customer_reviews.text: We've bought three of these now. Apparently they are sending out "Version 2", which is clearly cheap and inferior. V1: dual articulate arms V2: some swivel hinge thing V1: Thick, robust metal and hinges with plastic covers V2: Cheap welded steal, painted black, looks like scrap metal Seriously, version 2 is total garbage, and they're just riding off the reputation from Version 1. I feel like they should have to make a new category to reflect this obviously cheaper, low quality, maximum profit version 2. If you could see it in real life next to their own Version 1, you would not buy this cheap welded scrap.
customer_reviews.author: GOB PROGRAM Y/N

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 27" Acer Monitors
customer_reviews.text: This item is exactly as described. Holds my 2 27 inch monitors perfectly. I have a small desk so this gives me so much more room to move around. It was very easy to set up and took about 15 minutes. The provided monitor screws are great. They make it really easy to screw in rather then having to use a screw driver for all the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Master Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great stand... Great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great dual monitor stand. To be honest this stand was more heavy duty than I expected. It holds my two 27" monitors without issue. Assembly was easy and the instructions were concise and easy to follow. The included cable management clips were a nice addition. This freed up so much space on my desk and gives me an easy way to adjust my screen positions as needed. I am very satisfied with this purchase and would recommend to anyone looking for a dual monitor stand.
customer_reviews.author: BK Stephens

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this again!
customer_reviews.text: I read a few reviews that claim that this product has been changed to the point that it is cheap and flimsy. This is my first time using this, and it is very sturdy and does not move after adjusting and tightening all the required bolts. I would suggest that you evaluate the desk you are placing this on, as the surface area and type is crucial when attaching this to any desk. I would buy this again if needed. My monitors have retained their position perfectly! I am using (2) LG Electronics UM57 25UM57 25-Inch Screen LED-lit Monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bongers

customer_reviews.title: Sags, and tilts forward... A LOT.
customer_reviews.text: Monitors are both roughly 16 LBS (well below the stated 22 LBS limit on each arm), and when placed in the forward position, the pole tilts forward... a lot. I removed one of the arms (as well as one section off the remaining arm), and it still tilts forward with 1 monitor (although much less). So basically, I'm using a single monitor on this unit, with half the arm removed. just to be passable. I just got the quad monitor stand from this company (hoping this unit will be a bit more stable). I have a feeling I'm going to end up with one monitor on each kit.
customer_reviews.author: PTN01

customer_reviews.title: Tools aren't durable. If screens are too heavy they sag down even if you screw the hardest you can.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'll ever buy another VIVO product again. I bought one a few years ago with no problems, but the one I recieved was really bad. The screws on the stand were TOO tight, so the tools that came with the product deformed and now they don't properly work anymore. It should be OUR job to tighten the screws to our needs. Really frustrating. I'd rather spend the extra money to get a premium stand.
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I'm very dissatisfied. The parts are cheap and some made of plastic. I had to use a wrench to SQUEEZE the metal piece close enough so the screw would actually tighten and hold the arms up so it won't slide down from a tiny amount of weight. I clearly ripped the paint off but there is no way to tighten it otherwise; poor and cheap design. This product is crap. The only reason I'm not returning is because I don't want to go through the headache of unscrewing that nightmare. Oh and if you don't have two of the same monitor, then your monitors will probably not be the same level in height like my photo shows.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money! Could be taller....
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is an ABSOLUTE STEAL! You will NOT find a dual monitor mount as reliable as this one for this kind of money. With that being said, I wish it could raise just a little taller. I will likely put a block between the vice and my desk (the clamp's throw is MASSIVE) to combat this. But trying to have a full laptop underneath of the monitor (MBP 16) covers the screen just a hair. Overall, it is easy to assemble and very sturdy. I have had my monitors on it for over a month with zero issues in an orientation that I do enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer N.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this if you are above average height
customer_reviews.text: The height adjustment on this is limited. I am about 5'11" tall, but have a slightly long torso as well. Using this with two 27" 4K screens, the screen are maybe about two or three inches too low, even with the height set to the maximum setting. This requires me to look down at the screens to get my work done, which causes neck strain. Height adjustment of each screen is also not configurable. Suggest you look elsewhere if you are tall. Otherwise, this is a sturdy mount that seems well built for a good price. Wish there was more cable management in the center, or that I could run the cables inside.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Schrameck

customer_reviews.title: Not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to give myself more space on my desk but eliminating the normal monitor stands and while this does serve the purpose, it’s definitely not exactly what I was looking for. I’m 5’4” and at the proper ergonomic height, my monitors are pretty low and the middle stem protrudes above the monitors so it’s not a sleek look. I was also disappointed about how difficult it was to move the monitors and would have enjoyed a bigger range in motion. Overall not bad, but not for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Ching L

customer_reviews.title: I have got to use a quote...
customer_reviews.text: "You have got to get one of these", okay semi quote. Point is this thing is so well made, thought out and has options of how you install it that are great. I have used these things at several workstations for years. Most had a flaw that made them problematic. This product was engineered by people who knew what those problems and flaws are and eliminated them all. Whether you need a single or a double as I used this time, you want to buy one of this companies products. They are Top-Shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Freakin love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my work desk and since then, I have had two other people see it and end up purchasing the same item for their desk. Times have changed and more people are working from home. This product makes it so easy for you to open up desk space. Who doesn't need that! The only issue I found was that the product requires screws. I was disappointing because I thought they were missing but when I did a closer check of all the paper I was going to throw away, I found those four small screws. Check the packaging before you throw anything away.
customer_reviews.author: Hawleyaz

customer_reviews.title: Falling Monitors
customer_reviews.text: Arm won't hold up my monitors, and monitors continue to tilt downwards (no matter how much I adjust with the allen key).
customer_reviews.author: Sarah K.

customer_reviews.title: This is a "beefy" dual mount...
customer_reviews.text: The only weak spot I discovered is where the detachable VESA mounting plates slide into the mount itself creates a slight wobble at that point. Ironic that this is a key feature in this model design and the reason I decided to go with this item instead of the Vivo STAND-V002M. Still, it's wasn't a deal breaker since my use is a stationary set-up and I'm very pleased with the look and function of this mount with my two Acer 27" monitors.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Monitor Mounting Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: I was and am impressed by this monitor mount. It is well constructed and seemingly very sturdy metal. Assembly was straight forward and the directions were as clear as I would expect them to be for such an product. I was midly concerned about the sturdiness of the product when just using the clamp mount option and two larger monitors. Alas mu concern was for naught! Clamped it to the edge of a desk, mount the monitors and it has not moved since! Very satisfied for the price considering it was an impulse buy after a day of next pain due to the work from home transition.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary T. Kahmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Good stand if you don’t need ergonomics or want both screens split in front of you
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy and has clips for cable management also came with attachment to desk side or for installation through a hole. The monitor installation is super easy due to how the monitors clip in. Arms are not the best and are short. If you have two 27” monitors you will not be able to adjust how they sit. With one 23 and one 27 I can barely adjust them. Ideally I wanted one monitor straight ahead and one pulled diagonally for movies/twitch chat. Unfortunately the short arms make this not possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really happy this worked out
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to get rid of the monitor stands to have a bit more space on my desk and I decided to get this mount based off the reviews. It was really simple to install with the instructions and to mount onto the desk. was pretty hesitant on how well this product was going to support the monitors and I am extremely pleased that it has upheld the monitors perfectly for my setup. My base connected to the desk is tightened to prevent any sliding and to keep it sturdy. Overall super happy I got this mount.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Sub par instruction manual
customer_reviews.text: So this thing is really sturdy, love the ability to easily rotate my monitor. I do wish it was a bit taller and I wish it was easier to move the monitors vertically rather than having to loosen with Allen wrench. Also something very basic I wish the parts were labeled. I’ve gotten crap quality items with proper labeling but this was a mission trying to match parts to the labeling in the instruction manual.
customer_reviews.author: Asim

customer_reviews.title: Terrific solution for two 27" monitors
customer_reviews.text: I mounted two Acer V277U monitors on this stand, and am impressed with how it is handling them. I went the straight clamp route, which I assume most are doing, and have no fears about them falling down. In fact, one of our kittens decided to climb the back of one of these monitors last night. The monitor went forward on the hinge a bit, but the stand held firm, so I just had to push the monitor back up.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Panaccio

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great mount. I like the design of the product and if you follow the instructions, it’s simple to install. I did end up making the left arm a little longer by adding an arm link from another mount I purchased onto the one I have (same one but single arm). You can adjust your monitors pretty much anyway you want with this. The only thing I wish you could do with them is adjust the height of the monitors individually. Both monitor arms are connected to one brace and that makes it to where if you want to adjust the height of one monitor you have to adjust both. Other than that I’d say this is a perfect product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 4 star
customer_reviews.text: The good thing it's sturdy. Feels high-end but there are a few issues. 1. It is heavy, way more then the weight of the 2 displays together. 2. The arms are not level even with the adjustment on the back. Both monitor are both the same make and model. 3. The there is no pad for not marring the desk on the bottom. Sound like it would not be a problem, but with a glass desk top (very thick) it is. 4. The arm motion and length is just OK. I have 2 each 27" monitors and they are too close. I was going to use on a corner desk but there is not enough room or angle.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price. Perfectly holds my two HP 22es monitors.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this VESA mount installed with my two HP 22es monitors for almost three months now. It's perfect to clear up a LOT of space at my desk. The mounting options included either a clamp type or a grommet mount that fits in an office desk. For my desk, I used the clamp option and so far, it's been secure and have absolutely no complaints with what it offers. There was also a single cable organizer at the veritable base as well, but adding additional Velcro straps would definitely better organize the wires. Regardless, the structure of this mounts makes it doable to organize your wires cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Justin E.

customer_reviews.title: STRONG MATERIAL
customer_reviews.text: Wow this baby is strong! Easy to maneuver and lock in place. This thing is so strong and heavy, I highly suggest having a strong desk to hold it! This thing clamped down with two 7 lb monitors almost took my desk in half. I was almost bottlenecked by my desk! Alas, I have a desk with a hole meant for this dual monitor situation and it works beautifully. I'm not a huge fan of the clamp. Having larger monitors limits the ability to hold the weight on a semi-decent desk well. If deciding, pick the one with the base stand, so it is not dependent on the weight/quality of the desk/clamp relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase for Office
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these when I first built my PC during the early stages of COVID. 2x24" monitors look sleek as hell on my desk now. Bought a second one because my company moved to complete remote in June. As such, I needed another one to host my workstation in the same room. Both are sturdy, however I warn against the mounting arms as they tend to stick out behind the stand a little bit. This is only an issue if your desk is flush with the wall and you want your monitors on the same wall. Other than that, nothing I would change about them.
customer_reviews.author: Amuhzon

customer_reviews.title: Tree of Screens
customer_reviews.text: All of it feels so sturdy. Good, heavy metal. I felt safe attaching my monitors to it. Has good wire routing clips. I'd have liked one more near the post, but that wasn't really a big deal. Smart little feature: A place to put the provided allen wrenches so you won't lose them. I am sure I got great value in return for my money on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Yui Daoren

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.  Too cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Should have guessed for the price it seemed too good to be true. During assembly, the mount arm would not stay put on the stand, 2 turns of the screw and the arm mount, close to the neck, split into 2. This is going to the trash can, I don't think I have the patience to return this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Arijit

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy mount
customer_reviews.text: Installed it last night, it was pretty straight forward and easy to set up. It's holding 2 curved monitors, one is 27" and the other is 24", with no problems at all. It feels super stable and sturdy, the clamp is solid. You also get a good bit of articulation out of the arms as well, you can even turn a monitor sideways if you wanted. You cannot move the monitors vertically, this arm is simply for side by side monitors, you can only tilt them up and down. It does what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jaden Hageman

customer_reviews.title: Wish the 17" was 19" tall pole.
customer_reviews.text: I have two 27" monitors and a I am bit tall, although not in the torso. It would have been better if I could raise the screens another inch or two. So I probably should have ordered the 39" pole, but that seemed way too tall. Ideally, a 19" or 20" pole would have been better. On the positive side, the stand is sturdy, and the monitor are well supported and I can angle them in at me for proper viewing. It was also easy to set up. But then I have a thick door desk type workspace so clamping on the monitor stand worked perfectly, no need to drill a hole for the post.
customer_reviews.author: G. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product; keep in mind the table you are mounting too.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for price. When utilizing the C clamp method, please keep in mind the table material. Initially I mounted to an office desk I purchased at Ikea. After a day the mount began to lean forward. I tried to reinforce by finding long steel plates to distribute the weight. Ended up using at home with desk that had a predrilled hole. For sturdiness, this option works best. FYI, These were two 24 inch monitors. Again, nothing against the product, just be cognizant of what type of table you are mounting it to.
customer_reviews.author: Colin House

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out but not sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of things to like about this stand, they even feature set screws to adjust the height of the monitors in relation to one another in case there is sag in the arms. Installing it is extremely easy and it looks good. The real issue is the screws for the Vesa Mount that it comes with are molded plastic, and not molded very well. They look melted and neither flat nor Phillips heads fit in them. In order to attempt to tighten the screws I had to use a pair of pliers, but when this mount cost double what some of the other dual arms cost it should come with usable screws.
customer_reviews.author: Paix

customer_reviews.title: Cheap metal, small range of motion, but extremely study
customer_reviews.text: The mount has pretty limited range of motion and the materials are super cheap (some of the screws fell apart and I got metal splinters). Nonetheless, it's a lot cheaper than the AmazonBasic's mount and once you install it and tighten everything (and you need to tighten everything or it will faceplant your expensive monitor), it's pretty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I found it to be extremely sturdy and perfect for my 2 curved 27" monitors. Perfect for my new build set up. You do have to adjust some of the screws tightness to get a secure hold, but didn't take more than a few minuets. Once you get everything adjusted, there is no doubt its not going anywhere. The bracket is amazingly sturdy and thick and all needed tools supplied!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great assembly packaging and instructions
customer_reviews.text: I liked the sturdiness of the bracket and pole. It’s a nice system and the cable management system is a nice addition. I also liked how all the nuts, bolts screws and required tools were included and individual wrapped . Makes assembly much easier. I gave the adjustability 3 stars as it requires and Allen wrench to adjust from a sitting to a standing position. I wish they would include a hand operated tee style handle to easily lower and adjust the mounting height along the pole. I just attached a magnet to the pole keep the Allen wrench handy. Overall a great product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the job
customer_reviews.text: Like many white collar folks I have to work from home during the virus time. Sick of using my laptop screen I wanted a solution that would allow me to have multiple screens but still have space on my tiny home desk. This is perfect. I picked up two HP P204 19" monitors on sale, and at 6lbs each they easily fit within the stands weight limits. I probably spent more time opening boxes and organizing screws than actually putting it together. It's sturdy, strong, and the arm design actually increases workable space for my desk since I can let the left monitor overhang.
customer_reviews.author: Review Master

customer_reviews.title: Solid stand at a solid price!
customer_reviews.text: I use this brand of monitor at work to support 3 24" FHD monitors. When the plague hit and i needed to add a second 27" 4k monitor to my setup at home, Vivo was a no-brainer. I don't think you'll find a better stand in the price range and as a tall person, having appropriate monitor ergonomics did wonders for my neck and back! Setup is relatively quick and easy and the stand is very stable. Yes there are nicer stands out there with better range of motion and articulating capabilities, but you will have to pay hundreds of dollars for them. If you're looking for a good stand at a very good price, this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Agraffe Machicolate

customer_reviews.title: Easy to line up monitors side by side.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace two separate monitor arms with which I could not get to line up the monitors properly on the horizontal axes, causing problems with excel spread sheet rows lining up. I am very happy with this new dual monitor holder as I can line the monitors up easily and lock them in place. This unit is heavy duty at an excellent price. I would defiantly buy again if I had another dual display to setup. This unit is not designed for the monitors to be moved up and down independently, but can be moved on the horizontal axes, tilted up and down, and rotated between portrait and landscape.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Both monitor arms have to be the same height, so you need two of the same monitors
customer_reviews.text: Both monitor arms have to be the same height, so you need two of the same monitors. I tried this stand with two different monitors and they didn't line up vertically. The screw that the monitor hooks onto also let's the bracket wiggle too much, so it was hard to get my monitor to not tilt forward. I really had to ratchet down the safety cap to keep the monitor from tilting forward. All of the adjustments are made with a hex key (allen wrench) which makes adjustments annoying. I would rather have some latches I could snap open and snap shut to make adjusting things easier.
customer_reviews.author: Billkamm

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again and recommend to anyone. Just make sure your monitors are not too wide.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on price compared to buying two monitor risers for work. Best decision I have made. The quality is unbelievable for the price. I work in manufacturing and have no idea how this can be made and shipped at this price point. It made my desk look so much cleaner and added to much space. Best $$$ I have spent in a long time! I bought a second one for my home computer. Note when you open it, it appears assembly will be difficult. That is because it can mount through a desk hole or on the edge. It has two sets of mounting hardware. Regardless of choice with marginal competence took < 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this desk mount for my husband who uses a laptop with two 24" monitors. The brand recommended to me cost twice as much as this one so I read the reviews and decided to give this mount a try. I don't have anything to compare it to, but I had no issues with the simple set up. It works well and adjusting the monitors is easy. My husband is 6'3" and he wished the monitors could go a bit higher, but I think he will find the height to be perfect at the highest setting. Those taller than my husband with a standard height desk may want the mount that can go higher.
customer_reviews.author: hey Sacha

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this
customer_reviews.text: Actually, this product is pretty damn good. I what recommended from a friend who used this for a work from home system that required a dual monitor setup. I'm very impressed with this. I can push the monitors away or bring them in right to the edge of my desk. What great about this is that it allows the monitor to vertical, so basically it turns so that you can read something longways. It's just awesome. I can work with one and kids can watch movies on the other. It's that versatile!
customer_reviews.author: Inexpensive doesn't mean cheap

customer_reviews.title: You might need a cross tip screwdriver.
customer_reviews.text: The ability to adapt it to just about any kind of desk makes this well worth the $30. I have two different weight monitors in two very different positions and it holds them steady. If you choose to you could also rotate your monitors - relatively freely. I believe - with a slightly longer mounting shaft - this mounting system could support 4 monitors without breaking a sweat. It comes with the hex head wrenches you'll need. One is longer to apply additional torque on the mounting arms. But the tool I was surprised to see missing was a cross tip screwdriver (my mounting method required it. This wasn't a problem for me - I have several).
customer_reviews.author: Fight for $15

customer_reviews.title: Just the ticket - sturdy and simple
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to get the monitors off the limited desktop space and more on eye-level for a new desk that doesn't have the platform I used to have. Kept putting off setting it up because I was afraid it wouldn't work with my glass-top desk, but finally set it up today. Works like a charm! The only thing I'd like is a little more range in vertical adjustment so that I could get my different monitor brands to be exactly at the same height. Probably an edge-case scenario as most people probably have the same monitors in their set up, but that's a long story not relevant here.
customer_reviews.author: S. Yordy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stand even with a 27" Monitor
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed and easy to assemble, this dual monitor stand really freed up a lot of space on my desk. Just don't expect to be able to constantly/easily move the monitors around. In order to keep them in place the hinge points have to be tightened down with an allen wrench. You can find a sweet spot of tension where some adjustment is possible, but it does take a bit of effort to adjust. That being said, if you know where you want your monitors to be and don't plan on moving them around a bunch this stand is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Vivo
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Vivo monitor mount. The first one was for a single monitor. I got a second monitor so I upgraded to this dual mount. This is a solid product. Worth every penny. It gives you all the adjustment points you need to position the monitors where you want them. I stand to work and wanted the monitors to be a bit higher so they were at eye level so I added a few pieces of scrap wood under the mounting clamp and it worked perfectly. The mounting arms don't stick out too much behind the monitors either.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dare

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it if you’re not handy
customer_reviews.text: I had this monitor splitter arm drilled onto a motorized raise desk. While it’s a great product, I would not recommend it to someone that’s not handy, or have access to a person that’s handy. Mounting plates had to be cut on the bottom because it’s blocking HDMI and power ports (see picture). Definitely need power tools to make this work. I chose to drill it onto the table instead of using the screw mount, because I don’t trust the clamp so didn’t even bother trying. The drilled arm not wobble and held its posture when I raise my desk up and down. It’s worth the money. Mounting plates should’ve been made universal though.
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia S

customer_reviews.title: if you can live without being able to adjust monitor height these are perfect
customer_reviews.text: These function as intended, they are about as cheap as you can get for monitor mounts. I've used them for several months now and they have never felt like they were going to slip or give. The only downside is that you cant adjust the height of your monitors without taking your monitors off. this means you would also need to remove all your cables and set the monitors down somewhere. it's pretty inconvenient if you're someone like me who is always fiddling with your stuff and trying to get the perfect ergonomics. however that's a sacrifice you make when deciding to go for a budget oriented product. Overall these work great and I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations more than once
customer_reviews.text: The construction is way better than I expected for the price and I'm really happy it came with thumbscrews. Easier to assemble than it first seems when you see all the parts lol. I was pleasantly surprised it supports rotating your monitors. I was a little worried when I ordered it that I would have issues getting both monitors to fit since I have two 27" monitors but there was some room to spare. The weight limit is 11lbs each and my monitors are 13.8lbs each - It works and is sturdy but it's a little tough to get the right vertical angle at this weight. Easily a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, wish I had not waited so long
customer_reviews.text: I have looked at getting a monitor stand many times and just kept pushing it off as something I really did not need but wanted, until I installed it. No more looking down at my monitors as I am 6' 2.5" tall so I now can look directly at them. This particular stand has great cable management and is very sturdy compared to other stands I reviewed and this is the reason I spent a little extra to get this stand. Installation was a piece of cake, and mind you I DIY everything.... but it was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Haack

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the unit is not bad. It seems well made for the most part, relatively easy to assumble (accept the majority of the parts that were not put together should already be out together before being sold), range of motion is okay except for one major problem... the left side sags more than the right and will not (no matter how hard I try) line up with the right monitor. (I also have one of the lightest 24" monitors out there at 7lbs) which makes it even more frustrating. I can't imagine how much sagging would happen to a heavier monitor. Buyer beware, check how much your monitors weigh before purchasing this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Rollingstone

customer_reviews.title: Great dual mount
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Sure wish it was made in USA & this happens to be my ONLY complaint. This desk dual mount is thoroughly impressive in each and every aspect. Hold my two 24" Acer monitors like a veritable Rock Of Gibraltar - and the range of motion is outstanding. Highly recommend!! See pics - the one pic (with red circle) just shows how I needed a small block of wood to allow the clamp installation to have a good solid bottom surface to press against..
customer_reviews.author: TLTrue

customer_reviews.title: For the price, you really can't complain
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to create more space on the desk for working from home office. If you want a monitor arm that you can swing and adjust often, this might not be the choice. I think it is more intended for lifting your monitors up and create a custom layout of your monitors. I drilled a hole to use the grommet installation option on our particle board ikea desk, which was about 1inch thick. It is holding up 2, 24in LCD monitors just fine. There isn't any drooping. Happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Chengcheng X.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and great price, but keep in mind the limited adjustment possible
customer_reviews.text: Very solid construction, and easy to put together. Three nitpick issues for me: 1) arms are just barely long enough for my two 24" displays, which means I can't angle them much. 2) Can't adjust the height of each side separately, and they aren't quite even out of the box. As a result, even with two identical displays, I can't adjust the alignment of each display vertically - see photo (very small, OCD issue for me probably). 3) Can't adjust the height without removing the displays from the arms. These things are part of the design, but it's a great stand at a great price. just be aware of the limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend a bit more money elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I decided to be cheap with my home setup and chose to purchase this. The range of motion is lacking, you can't even have both arms at different heights. The mounting hardware was not great. I had to go out and purchase screws from Lowe's because one snapped in half. If you have two monitors that are both exactly the same, and you don't plan on moving your monitors orientation at all, then this mount will be perfect for you. Buy a separate hardware kit though..
customer_reviews.author: spacecowboy

customer_reviews.title: Decent Monitor Stand for the price !!
customer_reviews.text: I have two 27" monitors attached to this stand. It is really sturdy and only has some slight adjustment tweaks but it is not a deal breaker at all. It is functional and clean. I didn't install the wire-guides (don't really care for them) since I use USB-C to connect to my MacBook Pro for both monitors. For the most part this has saved me from spending $$$$ on a Dell 49" Curve Ultra-Wide which is the equivalent of two 27"... Look - if you are checking out dual monitor stands at the lower $50.00 range, this is a good deal. If you are looking for more features, then you should look somewhere else. Good product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bittan

customer_reviews.title: Requires additional adapters at $20 per piece
customer_reviews.text: I have four new computers / monitors. AOC, Asus, HP & Samsung. This does not work with ANY of the four unless I want to take a gamble and drill into the back of my monitor. Otherwise, I'll have to buy 4 adapters at $20 per piece with would be an additional $80.
customer_reviews.author: kellie

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the bolts and screws are tight!
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy duty VESA mount for the price. Took about 20 minutes to assemble. There is a big caveat with this though. Make sure the bolts and screws are tight! If you think they're tight enough, tighten them some more. I thought they were tight when I attached everything, but the monitors kept flopping around, banging on each other You'll also probably want a second set of hands to hold the monitors while you attach it to the pole since the bolt that tightens it can be a bit loose.
customer_reviews.author: Eric A.

customer_reviews.title: Solid mount, but slight uneven level with identical monitors
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid mount that has a sturdy design and easy to install features. However, upon mounting both of my 27inch monitors (identical models), I noticed the right monitor is about a quarter of an inch lower than the left one. I tried adjusting the height with the built-in height adjustment feature using the provided allen wrench, but it still won't be level. Further, that minor adjustment feature causes the monitor to wobble a bit. I believe the right mount's main arm slightly slags a bit, causing the uneven level. It seems to be a manufacturing defect of some kind. Still a decent mount for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Count Bezukhov

customer_reviews.title: Dual Monitor setup for motorhome
customer_reviews.text: We bought this mount to hold a pair of 21" computer monitors for our desk in the motorhome. The mount is good and heavy and seems well built. We haven't taken it for a drive yet to see how well the monitors travel, but that will likely be a trial and error process. The initial install went very well and I'm very happy with the mount. An additional benefit that I wasn't expecting was that we gained back the space directly under the monitors where the old mounts would have been. Bonus!
customer_reviews.author: David Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a 34" (21:9) monitor and a 24" (16:9) monitor set vertically. I made it work and it's holding up well. It IS leaning more toward the 34" side though because of how far out I had that arm pushed. It's only been a couple weeks but no issues so far. I like it much more than my older freestanding monitor stand. Frees up so much space.
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: Better than you think. This is the one to get!
customer_reviews.text: Have been looking at many of these. Because of the reviews and price decided to give this a try. Was surprised how well it was made. I had it installed in 30 minutes, including drilling a hole in the desktop. The clamp would not work on my desktop. Supports 2 24" monitors. Really helps with the home office where I manage 100's of remote computer systems and software product environments. Almost like being in the office now. This is the one you want!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mccwho

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand instructions
customer_reviews.text: These arms seem very good. I bought a couple for my sit/stand desk riser. The arms went together without much trouble. One thing, if you need to drill your own hole (as I did) the instructions say to use a 3/8" or 10mm bit. Use the 10mm if you have one, or else ream out the hole a little with your 3/8 bit. Otherwise you'll have to tap threads for the bolt, and it's a long bolt. You might want to bring your ratchet too. The wrench they provide will get the job done, but it's more hassle than needs be.
customer_reviews.author: OpenSprit

customer_reviews.title: Life is better with more desk space
customer_reviews.text: I have been working from home for months now. Desk real estate is hard to come by, And the lack thereof can be frustrating. This is a highly efficient product to return much of the table top space glommed by monitors. It is well priced, well made. If I had to find any criticism, it does need to be assembled. Not many parts but some parts. It clamps on table or it can go through the table top well. You won't be unhappy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart B

customer_reviews.title: Easily mounted two 27” monitors
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mounting system. I feel like it frees up so much desk space and looks organized. I mounted two 27” monitors with no issue at all! It gives you the option to clamp or utilize the existing desk grommet. I chose the grommet method and it was incredibly easy and fast to step up. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chris Hess

customer_reviews.title: WARNING. This is not worth the effort. Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst mistake I have made while trying to go for aesthetics. This mount requires you to have the strength of a gorilla to be able to loosen the arms because normal human strength just won’t do. The Allen key provided was about to break that’s how much force I have to apply to get it to move at certain joints. Also do not make the mistake of trying to loosen the arms near glass. I tried to loosen the arm near my $250 computer case and the key twisted and moved the entire desk causing the case to fall and shatter. What a worthless piece of junk. Cost me $250. Would never recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mohsin Azmi

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, doesn't need a lot of clearance, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a different brand that failed on me. One of my monitors is about 12 lbs, the other is quite light. They are 21" and 23" in size. This stand is easy to assemble (easier than it looks when you first unpack it), is sturdy and holds the monitors with no wobble or jiggle as I type. The adjustment is easy and the arms don't require a lot of clearance behind the desk. Overall, I'm very satisfied with the monitor stand, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deamis

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but missing one key part...
customer_reviews.text: I’d give this less stars if it wasn’t still a good quality product. My only problem was that out of all things, the FASTENER was missing (it normally comes inserted and is not a separate assembly piece). So the one piece that ties the entire product together was left out during production. Despite this flaw, I didn’t want to return this item since I felt I could fix it myself. Should anyone else encounter this problem, the best way to fasten the arms to the pole base is to tighten an M7 1.00-30 hex bolt/nut with a socket wrench and pliers. This is a great product, but the attention to detail in the production and warehousing departments could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stephenson

customer_reviews.title: Misleading about multiple sized monitor support, watch out
customer_reviews.text: This device claims to have the capability of supporting two different sized monitors but they will not align correctly. Customer support has informed me the only way to do this would be to purchase an additional piece of hardware (STAND-VAD3) which then gives you the ability to move one of the two monitors up and down to align correctly. However, this additional piece of hardware is half the cost of this dual mounting bracket. Between the cost of the dual bracket and this additional hardware it may be cheaper for you to purchase two single monitor mounts and have more control over positioning.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Cool, but up and down adjustment is bad
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Easy to assemble and attach to the monitors -Have some extra space on desk for other things Cons: -Raising and lowering the monitor is pretty much a joke. There is a small nut on the back of the monitors it says to adjust to raise and lower, but I’ve now gone as low as I can on my left monitor and as high as I can on the right monitor and they are not even close to being the same height. -Nut is now stripped from trying to go as high and low as I can
customer_reviews.author: Call Family

customer_reviews.title: Assembly seemed intimidating, until I actually got started.
customer_reviews.text: This stand came broken down into so many parts, it took me a week to get from opening the box to starting the assembly... Then it took only 1 hour to put it together... Not counting the trip to the hardware store for 8 additional plastic spacers that I needed to make it work with my monitors. If you have Dell P2314H monitors, or something with a similar sunken mount, then grab the washers and use the included screws... Or you could look for slightly shorter screws.... Either way it is a tiny inexpensive additional item you may need. Also included a picture of my full setup. It works great with my sit/stand desk.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Forge

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor stand up for about a week. So far this has worked very well. The monitors are easy to adjust, however one seems to slide at a slow rate so it needs to be adjusted more often. I have tried tighening if further, but do not think it will tighten anymore. The wires do have a management system, which is one clip on each side and one on the larger main pole. I used additional velcro wire keepers to help them be a bit more organized. Would work best on a sturdy desk.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda M.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Good Build Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit concerned whether the stand is gonna wobble since the pictures did not truly convince me. However, as soon as I opened the package, I knew that 4.5 star by more than 3000 reviews is something to trust. The stand is made in China, but unlike typical low cost China made products, this one uses thick/strong materials that is not truthfully revealed in the pictures. To make it short, assembly was easy enough. No wobble after two old (and heavy) 23 inch HP monitors installed. Most importantly, wife is happy to have reclaimed desktop space with two monitors up at the right height. I highly recommend this product made by Vivo.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on multiple desks now, and love it. It does not work on some wood desks, where there is a backing, or thick boards vertical on the the back of the desk, so you need to know where you are mounting it. The clamp opens plenty big if you have to make adjustments. I have 2 monitors, substantially different weights, because one is much older, and this does not lean or bend or anything. I was hoping this would be perfect, and it is!
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Gaffigan

customer_reviews.title: Monitors will not line up
customer_reviews.text: I have tried everything to adjust my monitors, which are exactly the same, HP 24W's, to the same height with no luck. The adjustment screws are all the way up on one and all of the way down on the other. There is still a 1/4 inch difference in height between the two. I will just be ordering a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: There are only 2 things I don't like about the mount. 1) All the arm screws are over-tightened out of the box to the point where you get no swivel/motion. The hex key actually felt like it would snap in half before the screws would turn. Put on a pair of shoes and turn the key by stepping on it if you want an easier/safer time. 2) My 2 identical 27" monitors don't sit level with each other even though the desk is level. Left monitor is slightly higher.
customer_reviews.author: S.768

customer_reviews.title: Buy a better one with arms that move up and down
customer_reviews.text: I would not buy this again. Arms are not fully adjustable and do not move up and down. I’m only 5’3 at with the arms at the top of the vertical pole, the monitors are too low. Also, the back of my desk has a narrow lip, so either the bottom clamp won’t touch the lip or the mount can’t be up against the desk otherwise it can’t clamp. Due to this, it isn’t study. If you still want to buy one, reach out to me and I will sell you this one for cheap. I might just donate it to a computer shop. Overall, it sucks
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Wright

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, no-frills, and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Like I said, it's sturdy, no-frills, and inexpensive. I have a dual monitor set up and the monitors took up the whole desk. This thing mounts to the back and opens up a lot of room. The one thing I noticed, however, is that it allows you to rotate your screen 90 degrees, which is nice, but if you have a wide screen monitor, you're going to want one that allows you to set the height of each monitor independently if you're planning on doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Very study and solid monitor dual monitor arm, great quality
customer_reviews.text: At my job I have basically the same set-up as you see in the pictures, only it is more expensive but not any more higher quality. The dual monitor arm has two possible set-ups in which it can fit through a hole in a table or be attached on the edge. I had time today to finally set-up the dual monitor arm and it was not very difficult. There are two different sticky pads to use depending on whether you use the grommett and hold set-up or the edge of the table set-up. I used both sticky pads to protect the upper and lower sides of the table. The pictures will show you how I did it.
customer_reviews.author: Musicman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, horrible assembly instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, horrible assembly instructions! My son installed them, followed instructions, and was about to loose his brand new monitor as it wasn't stable due to unstable height ring until I discovered by pure luck that the tightening bolt should be installed in opposite direction, but not a single hint about this probably fatal mistake in the instructions manual! Other that this, fantastic build quality, very sturdy, good looking, and fully flexible stand.
customer_reviews.author: Wael Abi-Haydar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect design but have your own tools
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed but the allen wrench provided was the wrong size. Luckily I had my own tools. This product is not designed to pivot and swivel. You set the monitors up to your liking and lock it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Monasterio

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy but..
customer_reviews.text: I'm a first time monitor arm buyer so maybe it's just me, but I noticed the neck leans a little forward. Honestly, it's probably because I need to tighten it a little more on my desk but one of the monitor allen-wrench-screws (that adjusts the monitor up or down so you can match the height of the other one) is completely stripped on the inside so I can't adjust it up or down. It was huge pain to get the monitors to TRY to be level with each other but the other one is still a little crooked. I had to tighten the bolt with pliers so it wouldn't move so much but overall, mostly pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mount, Too Short
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid, just isn't very tall. Once you hit the top of the pole, you're done. I'm 6'1", I'm always looking down. I would give it less stars, but again, this thing is solid. No Wobble; holds a 24" Dell flat, and a 27" curved AOC just fine. No tilt. If this thing were just a a few inches taller it would be perfect. It's just that if I sit with correct posture my eye line is way closer to the top of the monitor than it is the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Defective product!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived defective. Spent a good amount of time and frustration assembling the mount. Then when it came to the actually putting my monitor onto the mount, I find that it causes my monitor to tilt instead of staying perfectly horizontal. This part of the mount isn't adjustable! Terrible. I tried many ways to fix this problem but to no avail. It renders my monitor unusable as the tilt is at least 35 degrees. Refunding this product immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: Great Stand
customer_reviews.text: Came fast as promised. Assembly was fairly simple. Pretty good range of motion, comes with necessary tools and screws and VESA brackets. looks clean, holds the weight pretty well. I have (2) 27" 4K Monitors. LG on the Right, fairly light monitor and HP on the Right, a lot heavier but held the weight. THey didnt sit quite flush to each other but its not that big of a deal, just something to thing about if you have 2 different monitors. Other than that great product for the price, def recommend it!.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Installed in 15 minutes
customer_reviews.text: Opened box, set it up, added my monitors and was ready to work within 15 minutes...I kid you not. Comes with everything you need, all that is required is a screwdriver if you want to tighten beyond hand strength. The bar is heavy, and sturdy feel. The motion is amazing, you can adjust hundreds of different options. The stand comes with multiple mounting options depending on desk size and desk type. Highly recommend this, I would buy again and again....its such an amazing price!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Lavalle

customer_reviews.title: Holds my 24" monitors with no problem
customer_reviews.text: I've used a few different dual monitor arms similar to this one over the years. This one is unremarkable (take that how you will) and works just fine for my needs. There are a few little things that could be improved, but nothing terrible and overall the quality was what I expected for the price. It's a good reasonably sturdy and well built monitor arm, but not great. What do you expect for something this cheap? I would buy it again unless I found one that looked better for the price, or a very similar one for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Good value but limited motion
customer_reviews.text: Excellent price. The range of motion is somewhat limited. This is not a dual fully articulating arm mount. So if you're expecting to be able to move your monitors to any position at a moment's notice this is not the mount for you. But, if you want to position your monitors and leave them in one position this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: eward

customer_reviews.title: Perfect and well priced.
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed. I bought this to hold two Sceptre 27" curved monitors (C275W-1920RN) and it works beautifully. The technical writing in the instructions was excellent. Very clear, and therefore easy to assemble. The product itself is clearly well engineered and made with high quality parts and materials. It feels very sturdy, which is reassuring when you have made an investment in dual monitors. It comes with a few different ways to mount the stand, which was helpful. I used the clamp, and it feels very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, but 27" monitor could use a little more range of motion.
customer_reviews.text: Contruction: All Steel in the right spots Sturdy: Extremely Ease of install: Super Easy Range of Motion: I have 27" monitors, and they are about the largest you'd want to go with these. Ideally, you may want to opt for a bit bigger arms. As you can see from my photos, because of the width of the 27" monitor, they are a little limited in how much you can push them back and still index them towards you. Not a fault of the product, but I'm sure a lot of 4k monitors are about 27".
customer_reviews.author: Danny Poppa

customer_reviews.title: This is the second one of these I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: Using this on a new desk to clean up the desk space. Opted for the clamp mount option (it also has a hole mount and drill option). Once its attached to the desk, its like the monitors are a part of the desk. holds two 24 inch ASUS monitors without issue. No slipping at all. The range of adjustment is great. My only wish is that it could adjust height independently for each monitor as I have two different models and there's a slight difference in screen position due to the VESA mounting holes on the monitors themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G

customer_reviews.title: Why spend more when this does it all?
customer_reviews.text: This is steadily holding an older (and heavier) 23in monitor, and a large and heavy 27 in monitor, without any issue. I was able to get the displays lined up exactly where i wanted them, with lots of options for positioning, and great stability once everything was tightened down. Cable management solution is really nice too; it was easier than many other monitor arms that I have used. Unless more or even larger monitors are required, this really is the mounting solution to get.
customer_reviews.author: tlking4

customer_reviews.title: It's not perfect, but for value, it's unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble; great instructions; all tools included; sturdy but not overbuilt. The base for the c-clamp could be another inch broader to deal with the leverage from the monitor arms; and the monitor heights are not separately adjustable beyond an inch or so. Thus, on an absolute quality scale, it would be 4 stars compared to the really expensive and highest-quality mounts (which I also use elsewhere). But I knew that when I bought this, and it's such a great value, I had to bump it back up to five stars. The cable and tool-management clips are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who don't move their monitors much
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this, but I like to switch between a primary monitor depending on which one I am focusing on for a current task ( 1 is a 27 inch high res, High color accuracy monitor, the second is is for gaming/entertainment) However, if you move one monitor to central view, it obstructs the view of the other due to the range of motion. I'll be ordering 2 single monitor vesa mounts to I can get full view of my screens when moving them back and forth. This vesa mount is best for those for don't move their monitors often, for those who do, I recommend something else.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Impressive stand
customer_reviews.text: The pictures and descriptions don't do this product justice. It seems study enough to stand on(don't do this), and offers a multitude of positions. My only gripe, and this is me really reaching, is that the screen is allowed to rotate too easily. There is no fastener to tighten that I can see to change this. That said there is enough passive resistance that your screen will stay in any position you place it in. The assembly takes a little effort, but the sturdiness of the stand makes up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Hindsight

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wow..I can’t believe I went 9 months without it?!?!?! This saved me so much needed space on my small 47x23” desk. It frees up room for me to actually study on there and can just move it out of the way. Now if you want to raise it up, you’ll have to be careful loosening the center bolt with the Allen key they provide and raise it up then tighten it again or else all the weight will come falling down. Very adjustable. They provide all tools needed except Philips head screw driver. And offer two ways of mounting it. Only time will tell if it’s really durable, but seems like it is.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M.

customer_reviews.title: One of the most budget friendly mounts ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for work, and it works great. It removes the footprint of the monitors that would otherwise restrict access for desktop "things". Build quality is simple and strong. It's built to last. The range of motion is perfect. I can adjust the height (though not dynamically like a hydraulic arm), and pivot 90 degrees to show someone sitting next to me something. For the price? 5 stars. You won't find anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Hinkston

customer_reviews.title: Great for what you pay
customer_reviews.text: I have no major issues with the monitorStand . All the 1 star reviews I saw sound like quality assurance issues and they got defective products. For the money, this thing is great. The only real complaint I have is adjustments. You have you use and Alan wrench to make most of the adjustments on it. But once you get it set where you wanted and tightened down, it is pretty solid. On top of that, If you have 2 different monitors and they don’t mount in the same spot, the monitors won’t sit at an even height. taking into account the price and the fact that I wasn’t looking for super high end, I give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT product! Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different dual monitor mount last week on Amazon for $25. It was a POS to say the least...I ended up selling it on the Facebook Marketplace for what I paid for it within a day (Thank God-i didn’t want the hassle with returning it back to Amazon). I did a little more research & bought this mount. This brand/mount was so easy to follow the instructions & assemble, tell which pieces went where etc. It was only $32 with free shipping! I wish I would have saw this item before I purchased the other but I’m happy I was able to resell the other. This item gets an A+++ from me! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Angelina

customer_reviews.title: Need the same monitors to level
customer_reviews.text: Very nice but limited range of motion. Can only tilt up and down but cannot move the arms around. For that reason, make sure both monitors are the same brand. We had a dell and a ASUS and the dell needs an adaptor to mount. And even with the adapter, it looked so weird and off— it was not in line with the other monitor. This is where not having the arms move around sucks. My husband made it work though but it was not easy. Overall, great if you have the same monitors
customer_reviews.author: Lilita

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and high quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two of these now. Since the COVID-19 pandemic has forced a lot of Americans into working from home we needed to make some adjustments. I have a 4 monitor set up on my desk at home which I am using for work. I placed them side by side and they look great. They are sturdy once tightened into place and secure. The OCD in me appreciates that I can make slight adjustments to keep everything level and in line.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Great price but did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: After days of searching, I was excited to get this product only to be disappointed. The assembly instructions are easy, I was able to assemble this and mount it to my desk within minutes of receiving the package. But when I got the monitor up on the mount, it could not hold the weight to keep the tilt at eye level. I tried to tighten the bolt for the tilt up or down on the arm but as soon as I slide the monitor on it tilted down immediately. The product is rated to hold up to 22lbs of monitor weight on each arm, but it could not hold 14.2lbs of ViewSonic VA2703-LED monitor, returning it for refund.
customer_reviews.author: H-P

product_meta.title: VIVO Dual LCD Monitor Desk Mount Stand Heavy Duty Fully Adjustable fits 2 /Two Screens up to 27" (STAND-V002)
feature_bullets: COMPATIBILITY - Dual monitor mount fitting two screens 13” to 27” in size and 22 lbs in weight each with 75x75mm or 100x100mm backside mounting holes
FULL ARTICULATION - Adjustable arm offers +80° to -90° tilt, 180° swivel, 360° rotation, and height adjustment along the center pole. Monitor can be placed in portrait or landscape shapes
DESK CLAMP - Mounts to the back of your desk (up to 4” thick) via a heavy-duty C-clamp or optional grommet mount
INTEGRATED CABLE MANAGEMENT - Keep your power and AV cables clean and organized with detachable cable clips on the arms and center pole
EASY INSTALLATION - Mounting your monitors is a simple process with detachable VESA bracket plates. We provide a step-by-step manual and the necessary tools & hardware for assembly
